He that dasheth in pieces is come up before thy face: keep the munition, watch the way, make <FI>thy<Fi> loins strong, fortify <FI>thy<Fi> power mightily.<RF>He…: or, The disperser, or, hammer<Rf>

For the LORD hath turned away the excellency of Jacob, as the excellency of Israel: for the emptiers have emptied them out, and marred their vine branches.<RF>the excellency of Jacob…: or, the pride of Jacob as the pride, etc<Rf>

The shield of his mighty men is made red, the valiant men <FI>are<Fi> in scarlet: the chariots <FI>shall be<Fi> with flaming torches in the day of his preparation, and the fir trees shall be terribly shaken.<RF>in scarlet: or, dyed scarlet<Rf><RF>flaming: or, fiery<Rf>
The chariots shall rage in the streets, they shall justle one against another in the broad ways: they shall seem like torches, they shall run like the lightnings.<RF>they: Heb. their show<Rf>

He shall recount his worthies: they shall stumble in their walk; they shall make haste to the wall thereof, and the defence shall be prepared.<RF>worthies: or, gallants<Rf><RF>defence: Heb. covering, or, coverer<Rf>
The gates of the rivers shall be opened, and the palace shall be dissolved.<RF>dissolved: or, molten<Rf>

And Huzzab shall be led away captive, she shall be brought up, and her maids shall lead <FI>her<Fi> as with the voice of doves, tabering upon their breasts.<RF>Huzzab: or, that which was established, or, there was a stand made<Rf><RF>led…: or, discovered<Rf>

But Nineveh <FI>is<Fi> of old like a pool of water: yet they shall flee away. Stand, stand, <FI>shall they cry<Fi>; but none shall look back.<RF>of old: or, from the days that she hath been<Rf><RF>look back: or, cause them to turn<Rf>

Take ye the spoil of silver, take the spoil of gold: for <FI>there is<Fi> none end of the store <FI>and<Fi> glory out of all the pleasant furniture.<RF>for…: or, and their infinite store, etc<Rf><RF>pleasant…: Heb. vessels of desire<Rf>
She is empty, and void, and waste: and the heart melteth, and the knees smite together, and much pain <FI>is<Fi> in all loins, and the faces of them all gather blackness.<CM>

Where <FI>is<Fi> the dwelling of the lions, and the feedingplace of the young lions, where the lion, <FI>even<Fi> the old lion, walked, <FI>and<Fi> the lion's whelp, and none made <FI>them<Fi> afraid?
The lion did tear in pieces enough for his whelps, and strangled for his lionesses, and filled his holes with prey, and his dens with ravin.

Behold, I <FI>am<Fi> against thee, saith the LORD of hosts, and I will burn her chariots in the smoke, and the sword shall devour thy young lions: and I will cut off thy prey from the earth, and the voice of thy messengers shall no more be heard.<CM>
